title: How to Avoid Seasonal Allergies?
cleaned_text:
Seasonal allergies are extremely common these days. The major causes are the imbalances in between the vata and the pitta doshas. Exposure to dust mites, pollen grains, certain food products like peanut, treenut, shellfish, soy, egg, vaccines, insects venom, proteins of the animals, body parts of the insects, certain antibiotics like penicillin and certain products of cosmetics. Seasonal allergies may be of various types. They may be asthma, allergic rhinitis, hay fever and many more.

According to Ayurvedic studies, kapha allergy is due to congestion, vata allergy is due to exposure to too much dryness, pitta allergy is due to the sinus inflammation.

Planet Ayurveda has provided some of the effective Ayurvedic medicines for allergies. These medicines are perfectly natural, vegetarian and do not possess any side effect at all. They do not contain any chemicals or binders, which make them 100 percent safe to consume.

Skin rashes, shortness of breath, running nose, dry skin, watery and itchy eyes, severe itching, swelling of the membranes, vomiting, wheezing, sneezing and nausea are some of the common and general symptoms of seasonal allergies. Any sudden undesirable modification in the human body is the symptom of seasonal allergy. It mainly takes place when the human body gets exposed to several types of allergens.
